meanings.definition: A quick summary or review of main points
meanings.sent1: During the meeting, the boss gave a rundown of the key decisions.
meanings.sent2: I always like to read a rundown of the news to stay informed.
meanings.sent3: The rundown of the story was so brief, it left everyone confused.
meanings.sent4: Her rundown of the events was like a map guiding us through the details.
meanings.sent5: The rundown of the rules made it easy to understand the game.

meanings.definition: In poor condition or in need of repair
meanings.sent1: The old house looked rundown with its peeling paint and broken windows.
meanings.sent2: The rundown car sputtered and coughed as it struggled to start.
meanings.sent3: Despite its rundown appearance, the cozy cabin had a lot of character.
meanings.sent4: The rundown building stood like a forgotten relic of the past.
meanings.sent5: The rundown playground equipment was a safety hazard for the children.

meanings.definition: To physically exhaust or tire out
meanings.sent1: After the long hike, the steep trail really rundown me.
meanings.sent2: I always feel rundown after a busy day at work.
meanings.sent3: Trying to keep up with the energetic kids rundown the teacher quickly.
meanings.sent4: The intense workout rundown my muscles, but it felt good.
meanings.sent5: The marathon rundown the runners, but they crossed the finish line with pride.

meanings.definition: To decrease in intensity or quality
meanings.sent1: As the movie progressed, the excitement began to rundown.
meanings.sent2: The singer's voice started to rundown towards the end of the concert.
meanings.sent3: The flavor of the soup seemed to rundown as it cooled down.
meanings.sent4: The energy of the party started to rundown as the night went on.
meanings.sent5: The enthusiasm for the project began to rundown after facing multiple challenges.
